description: Largest square less than or equal to sum of previous terms.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: a(6) = 9 since 1+1+1+1+4+4 = 12 and 9 is the largest square less than or equal to this.
prog: (Haskell)a061886 n = a061886_list !! na061886_list = 1 : zipWith (-) (tail a060984_list) a060984_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 24 2013
author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 12 2001
